summary.para: The AM_DVD_GRAPH_FLAGS enumeration specifies how the DVD Navigator builds a DVD playback graph. These flags are used with the method.

remarks.para: Do not combine more than one of the following flags:
If you have already selected a video renderer by calling , do not set the AM_DVD_VMR9_ONLY or AM_DVD_EVR_ONLY flag.

To use the VMR-9, the decoder's method must return the AM_GETDECODERCAP_QUERY_VMR9_SUPPORT flag. To use the EVR, the decoder's GetDecoderCaps method must return the AM_GETDECODERCAP_QUERY_EVR_SUPPORT flag.

summary.para: Use a hardware decoder if possible. If none is available, use a software decoder. This is the default setting. Hardware DVD decoders are registered under the CLSID_DVDHWDecodersCategory filter category. See Filter Categories.
Use a hardware decoder; do not use a software decoder. Do not combine this flag with the AM_DVD_VMR9_ONLY or AM_DVD_EVR_ONLY flag.
Use a software decoder if possible. If none is available, use a hardware decoder.
Use a software decoder; do not use a hardware decoder.

Do not show video on the computer monitor. Use of this flag should be limited only to the combination of a hardware DVD-Video decoder and a display device with a port that can connect to a TV. A set-top box type of device that can play back DVD-Video could play DVD titles to be viewed on a TV set rather than a computer monitor.

Do not clear the filter graph before building the DVD playback graph. By default, the method removes any existing filters from the graph before it builds the DVD playback graph. Note Applies to Windows Vista and later.
Use the Video Mixing Renderer Filter 9 (VMR-9) for rendering; fail if the VMR-9 is not available. Do not combine this flag with the AM_DVD_EVR_ONLY flag.
Use the Enhanced Video Renderer (EVR) for rendering; fail if the EVR is not available. Note Applies to Windows Vista and later.
